executive_summary: Somnath Kshirsagar is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) diagnosed in 2021. His current HbA1c is 7.9%, which is above the target, indicating a need for improved glycemic control and management of cardiovascular risk factors.

interpretation.assessment: Current HbA1c is above the target for T1DM.
interpretation.plan: Consider insulin regimen adjustment and education on carbohydrate counting.

interpretation.assessment: LDL is above the target for cardiovascular risk.
interpretation.plan: Initiate lifestyle modifications and consider statin therapy.
Implement dietary changes and increase physical activity.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week.
Limit alcohol intake to no more than 14 units per week.

diet_plan.principles: Focus on a balanced vegetarian diet rich in whole grains, fruits, and vegetables while limiting saturated fats and sugars.
sample_meals: Chickpea salad with mixed vegetables and olive oil dressing
Quinoa with steamed broccoli and grilled tofu
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use portion control to manage carbohydrate intake, aiming for consistent carbohydrate distribution throughout the day.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels between 4-7 mmol/L and post-meal levels below 8.5 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose levels at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia and ketones.

patient_goals: Reduce LDL cholesterol to < 2.0 mmol/L within 6 months.
Engage in physical activity for at least 150 minutes weekly.

medication_plan.text: Consider starting a statin for lipid management.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c, lipid levels, and review lifestyle changes.

emr_note: Patient is a 43-year-old male with T1DM, HbA1c at 7.9%, elevated LDL and triglycerides. Lifestyle modifications and potential medication adjustments discussed.
